content.description:
Climb up the vertical hand crack. 

 Since it's a relatively short route, this route is a nice introduction for learning how to layback.
content.protection:
You can belay off of limited trees at the top, but there are plenty of options for a gear based anchor further back if you have a long static rope (100 feet) for your anchor.

 Bouldering pads would also work great, the landing is relatively flat.
content.location: Look for the obvious hand crack on climber's left of Crag 5.

content.description: The crack goes from fingers to off fingers size and is short and sweet.
content.protection: For a toprope anchor, there are options for both a gear or tree based anchor.
content.location: It is in the middle of Crag 5.

content.description:
This is a 20 foot crag that faces NE with sort of a peaked summit.

 L->R:

 A. Left End Layback, 4, 1p, 20', gear or TR. B. Finger Crack, 9, 1p, 20', TR. C. Sexy Freshmen, 4. D. Right End Corner, 2.
